intro: Tithymalus segetalis, commonly known as the field tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy to the touch. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and agricultural fields. Tithymalus segetalis is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and flies.
